question: Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa has been re-elected as the President of which nation?
explanation:
Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa has been re-elected as the President of Portugal. The right-wing President won the elections with 60.7 percent of the vote.
Although the Prime Minister Antonio Costa is a Socialist, the President has a prominent role in the nationâ€™s polity with superior role in foreign policy and national security. President of Portugal has the power to dissolve the Parliament.
